about.description: Orbit is a Python package for Bayesian time series forecasting and inference. It provides a familiar and intuitive initialize-fit-predict interface for time series tasks, while utilizing probabilistic programming languages under the hood. For details, check out our documentation and tutorials: - HTML (stable): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ - HTML (latest): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ Currently, it supports concrete implementations for the following models: - Exponential Smoothing (ETS) - Local Global Trend (LGT) - Damped Local Trend (DLT) - Kernel Time-based Regression (KTR) It also supports the following sampling/optimization methods for model estimation/inferences: - Markov-Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) as a full sampling method - Maximum a Posteriori (MAP) as a point estimate method - Variational Inference (VI) as a hybrid-sampling method on approximate distribution PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/](https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/)
about.summary: Orbit is a package for bayesian time series modeling and inference.
